properties.name: ALTENHOFEN COUNTRY INN
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia 647 Herrick Rd, Sedgwick, ME‎ A four bedroom B&B plus a self-sufficient apartment are available from Memorial Day to Labor Day.

properties.name: Balsam Cove Campground
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia 286 Back Ridge Rd, East Orland, ME‎

properties.name: Blue Hill Farm Country Inn
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia 578 Pleasant St, Blue Hill, ME‎ After a restful sleep you will awake to a breakfast of home baked breads and muffins, fresh fruit, cheeses and hot coffee. Before touring you may choose to sit and chat around the woodstove in the large living room which was once the barn. The Blue Hill Farm Country Inn is one of the Maine\'s friendliest inns. From your lodging explore Downeast Maine, Acadia National Park, Bar Harbor, the Schoodic Peninsula, Isle au Haute, Deer Isle, and Stonington. Each of the 14 guest rooms is decorated differently featuring furnishings unique to rural coastal Maine. Accommodations Include: 10 Double Rooms - Double Bed 3 Double Rooms - Twin Beds 1 Single Room - Single Bed

properties.name: Blue Hill Inn
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia 40 Union St, Blue Hill, ME‎ Located on an acre of land near the center of the village of Blue Hill and a block from the head of Blue Hill Bay, the inn is one of 76 structures on the National Register of Historic Places. Mature trees, a perennial garden, and a small grove of apple trees enhance the grounds. A Federal period building, the Blue Hill Inn has eleven guest rooms, a dining room, and two parlors. It retains many of its original features, including clapboards, brick ends, nine over six windows, wide soft pumpkin pine floor boards, and six fireplaces. Adjacent to the inn is the recently developed "Cape House," a luxury suite. The Blue Hill Inn Environmental Policy The Blue Hill Inn enthusiastically supports the developing concepts of eco-tourism, sustainable triple bottom line business practices, and green lodging practices. The inn has been awarded the Environmental Leader designation in recognition of efforts made at the inn, including using environmentally friendly cleaning supplies and light bulbs, composting kitchen waste, and recycling all waste possible.

properties.name: DragonFlye Inn
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia 19 Naskeag Road, Brooklin, MEAt the tip of Blue Hill Peninsula, Brooklin, Maine offers a quiet retreat within a short drive of Bar Harbor and Acadia National Park to the East, and Deer Isle, Stonington and Castine to the West A one-minute walk from DragonFlye\'s doorstep brings you into the historic village of Brooklin Maine and its old-time general store (with sandwiches and a wine shop), the Morning Moon café, several restaurants, an Irish Guinness Pub, numerous art galleries, a public library, and a post office. A fleet of bicycles awaits enjoyment by all guests. Away from summertime crowds, Naskeag Point offers a safe/low-traffic environment for cycling. In less than ten minutes you can cycle to one of several beaches for a picnic or a stroll. Numerous small tracks crisscross Naskeag Point, and, at the end of Naskeag Point Road, you can watch lobster boats unload their catch while you enjoy a packed lunch at the waterfront park.

properties.name: Edgehill Farmhouse
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia 567 Reach Rd, Sargentville, ME567 REACH RD, SARGENTVILLE, MAINE: This is the site of the wedding, where you will eat Mexican food and drink some drinks and engage in general fun.

properties.name: Eggemoggin Inn‎
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia Babson Point Dr, Deer isle, MEEggemoggin Oceanfront Lodge makes your dream come true! Did you ever want to stand on an oceanside deck watching Maine lobster fisherman haul traps in your front yard, or watch the Maine windjammer fleet sail the beautiful waters of Eggemoggin Reach? You will find yourself in the middle of historical Maine boating yachting grounds, the home of seafaring men and women for more than 200 years. This is Downeast Maine. Enjoy your comfortable stay in our beautiful waterfront rooms, each with private bath, overlooking Eggemoggin Reach and your private 200 foot dock. Relax in the post and beam Great Room enjoying a fire in the fieldstone fireplace, and enjoy a hearty continental breakfast while watching the gulls soar right outside your window.

properties.name: El El Frijoles
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia 41 Caterpillar Hill Road, Sargentville, ME‎ El El Frijoles is a California-Style taqueria located in a barn on the coast of Maine. We offer fresh and delicious Mexican cuisine in a fabulous and most unusual setting. This is who is going to be feeding you on our wedding day. Lucky you.

properties.name: Goose Cove Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia Sunset, MECurrently the lodge accommodates 70 guests in 21 private cottages, rooms and suites, dotted across 22 acres of coastal forest. The accommodations are rustic and tastefully decorated. All have private baths, and most have fireplaces. Cottages have private decks with Adirondack chairs. The East Wing has a large shared deck and an unsurpassed view of the bay and ocean beyond.

properties.name: Greenlaw's Mobile & RV Park
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia Stonington, ME

properties.name: Inn at Ferry Landing
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia 77 Old Ferry Rd, Deer Isle, ME‎ The Inn at Ferry Landing stands by the water on Deer Isle, Maine, looking north over the Eggemoggin Reach. We are 3 hours north of Portland, Maine and 45 minutes southwest of Bar Harbor. Formerly the station for the Deer Isle ferry, the Inn is on a cul-de-sac with gorgeous views of schooners sailing by and under the beautiful suspension bridge. Guests enjoy the famous local crafts, our serene beach and the star-filled sky at night, all in an undisturbed atmosphere. All guest rooms have a private bath and waterview, and Jean cooks breakfast daily for guests in the main house. Yes, we are open year-round!

properties.name: Oakland House Seaside Inn & Cottages‎
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia 435 Herrick Rd, Brooksville, ME‎ AN HISTORIC EAST PENOBSCOT BAY INN... at Herricks Landing on the Shore of Eggemoggin Reach in the Heart of the Blue Hill Peninsula. Brooksville, Maine Nestled on 50 acres of oceanfront paradise, this Maine resort offers comfortable relaxed Maine lodging in spacious Maine coast cottages and rooms at Shore Oaks Seaside Inn

properties.name: Old Quarry Campground
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia Spruce Harbor RdOld Quarry Campground is a very special place to us and to the people that visit. We have kept the campground small so that it offers privacy and quiet, and designed it so that vehicles are kept away from most of the camp sites in the parking lot. Large garden carts are available to move equipment. Old Quarry Campground accommodates large RV\'s only during the off season (from April 1 through June 30 and from September 7 through November 2) but popups and small RV\'s are always allowed in Sites #1 and #9 and the parking lot. Old Quarry campground offers ten campsites for tent camping. Seven of the camp sites are in the woods, spread far apart so that you can have plenty of privacy on your Maine camping experience. One of these wooded sites is on the shore line (Ocean Site). Three of the camp sites are in an open area and are great for groups of campers or those wanting lots of sun while camping. Each camp site has a 12\' x 12\' tent platform, an 8-foot picnic table, 2 deck chairs, and a fire grill. Overflow sites without platform, fire ring, or picnic table, are also available.

properties.name: Red House Bed and Bath
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia Little Deer Isle, MEAt The Red House Bed and Bath, we have been welcoming travelers to the coast of Maine — Penobscot Bay and Deer Isle — since 1995. Following a devastating fire in 2001, we built a new Red House. It is our pleasure to share our special home year-round. It is spacious and quiet, with a relaxed and informal atmosphere. The temperate maritime weather is a welcome relief from sweltering summer heat. Clear night skies encourage unparalleled stargazing of the Milky Way, the midsummer Perseid Showers and Northern Lights in the cool nights of autumn. Our big deck overlooks granite ledges and gardens, looking down toward the water. It is a great spot for watching birds, enjoying the sun, a good book and a glass of wine. It is just a short walk down to the water for a cold swim and views of the Eggemoggin Reach. We are also only 1/2 mile to a public beach and many walking trails protected by the Island Heritage Trust. We are proud to be a certified Maine Environmental Leader.

properties.name: Sunrise Cottages
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia 186 Varnumville Road, Brooksville, ME‎ Looking for a tranquil vacation? A Downeast Maine Country Experience, far from the maddening crowds... Come stay with us in our cozy and classy cottages, close to the ocean and ponds for canoeing or kayaking, with acres of wooded trails for hiking, and miles of quiet backroads for biking. This is your place. We have it all, nature at its best, yet not too far from gift shops, antiques, music, art galleries, and fine dining. Enjoy the breakfast of your choice in our Breakfast Shed overlooking the farm pond. A Downeast Country experience without the crowds!

properties.name: Sunshine Campgrounds
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia 1193 Sunshine Rd, Deer Isle, ME

properties.name: The Allen Home
properties.description: Posted by Laurenandalicia 774 Hinkley Ridge Rd, Blue Hill, METhis is where Alicia\'s parents, Tim and Diane, live.
